meanings.definition: To obtain something through flattery or deceit.
meanings.sent1: She was fleeching her way into getting a better grade by complimenting the teacher.
meanings.sent2: He tried fleeching his boss for a promotion by constantly praising his work.
meanings.sent3: The cat was fleeching for more treats by rubbing against its owner's legs.
meanings.sent4: The politician was fleeching the voters with promises he had no intention of keeping.
meanings.sent5: The salesman was fleeching the customers into buying unnecessary products with false compliments.

meanings.definition: To beg or plead for something in a persistent manner.
meanings.sent1: The child kept fleeching for a new toy every time they passed the store.
meanings.sent2: She was fleeching her parents for permission to go to the party.
meanings.sent3: The dog was fleeching for attention by barking loudly at the guests.
meanings.sent4: The beggar on the street corner was fleeching for spare change from passersby.
meanings.sent5: The student was fleeching the teacher for extra credit to improve their grade.
